result.execSummary:
The defendant Holly A Elwood was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week as determined by the agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain a stable residence.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Holly A Elwood in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft missed Court on 11/16/15.
Deft indicates she missed her bus from Milwaukee that day.
Deft has filled out the form for a Court appointed atty.
Deft has gone to the SPD's office but does not qualify.
State is concerned that the deft keeps missing court but is understanding that she is coming from Milwaukee.
State indicates if the deft's ZCI test come back positive they will be asking for a high cash bond and a trial date.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT, reinstate bond, Deft must go to ZCI after court today, Court appointed atty granted, repayment to be determined at a later date.

Pre-Trial Conference and Order/case adjourned off the record.
Status conference on July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Holly A Elwood in court.  Christopher D. Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 2, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
